meanings.definition: A compound released by cells in response to injury or allergic and inflammatory reactions, causing contraction of smooth muscle and dilation of capillaries.
meanings.sent1: Histamines help our body respond to injuries by making muscles contract and blood vessels widen.
meanings.sent2: Doctors use antihistamines to treat allergies by blocking the effects of histamines in the body.
meanings.sent3: The histamines in my body were like little messengers, telling my muscles to tighten and my blood vessels to open up.
meanings.sent4: Her anger was like a surge of histamines, causing her to feel a sudden rush of emotions and physical reactions.
meanings.sent5: The histamines acted like tiny workers, swiftly signaling the muscles to tighten and the capillaries to expand.

meanings.definition: A substance that is released by cells in response to injury and in allergic and inflammatory reactions, causing contraction of smooth muscle and dilation of capillaries.
meanings.sent1: When the body senses an injury, it releases histamines to help with the healing process.
meanings.sent2: Allergic reactions can trigger the release of histamines, leading to various symptoms like itching and swelling.
meanings.sent3: The histamines in the body were like little messengers, delivering the signal for muscles to tighten and blood vessels to expand.
meanings.sent4: His words acted like histamines, causing a ripple effect of emotions and reactions among the group.
meanings.sent5: The histamines worked like traffic controllers, directing the flow of muscle contractions and capillary dilation.
